example.text: You heard them [[user]]!! Republicans need to get out of the way and let [[user]] ‘s plan to cancel student debt move forward so that millions of Americans aren’t drowning in debt because they decided to get an education. [[url]]

As soon as we put people in cages we animalize them. But as I told [[user]], we have positive ways to lower crime like investing in education, mental health services, and affordable housing. It's time our government start investing in prevention. [[url]]

This month we also announced nearly $100 million in federal dollars for critical resources in our district. Each of these projects will move us forward as a community: launching workforce development initiatives in Yonkers; providing at risk youth opportunities to reduce youth violence in Westchester; helping New York City support unhoused children, families, and asylum seekers; providing senior programming at NYCHA developments; addressing the need to rehabilitate the Lake Isle Dam and so much more.

If you don’t care about our kids, you don’t care about our country. Republicans are okay with our kids suffering and dying for the sake of politics. We need the right people in office to actually get to work on the issues that we all care about. [[url]]
Do not tell me about the health of our economy if we cannot protect our kids. We are sick as a society if we allow our children to get slaughtered by assault rifles and guns. We are sick. [[url]]

On days like this, it's so important to be with your community to honor those we've lost. In their memory, we need to prioritize peace and diplomacy to prevent sending our fellow citizens into harm's way needlessly.

Title 42 ends today. I wish we could pause to celebrate the ending of this problematic policy and create a plan to provide supports that asylum-seekers need, but instead our Republican-led Congress has brought one of the most extreme and cruel immigration bills to the floor ?
